questions: What are the eligibility criteria for BTech admission at this university?
para_question1: What are the requirements for getting into NMAMIT BTech program?
para_question2: What are the qualifications needed for BTech admission at this university?
Answers: Candidates must have passed Class 12 or equivalent with a minimum of 45% aggregate marks in Physics, Mathematics, and Chemistry/Biotechnology/Biology/Computer Science/Electronics, with English as one of the languages of study. They should be at least 17 years old as of 31st December of the admission year.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: How can candidates apply for the NUCAT exam?
para_question1: How do people apply for the NUCAT test?
para_question2: How do applicants submit an application to take the NUCAT exam?
Answers: Candidates can apply for the NUCAT exam by completing and submitting the Online NUCAT registration form available at apply.nitte.edu.in.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: What scholarships are available for NUCAT toppers?
para_question1: Are there any scholarships available to NUCAT toppers?
para_question2: What scholarships are there for NUCAT toppers?
Answers: Toppers in NUCAT can avail scholarships ranging from 20%-40% of the prescribed fee.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: Who falls under the NRI category for BTech admission?
para_question1: Who can apply to Btech admission as an NRI?
para_question2: Who is considered an NRI for BTech admission?
Answers: Foreign Nationals, PIOs, Overseas Citizens of India, candidates who passed Class 12 outside India, and those sponsored by parents/blood relatives having NRI status fall under the NRI category.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: How are seats allocated for NRI category candidates?
para_question1: How many seats are there for NRI people?
para_question2: How are seats allotted to candidates who fall under the NRI category?
Answers: Seats are allocated based on the marks secured in the optional subjects in the qualifying examination for NRI category candidates.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: What documents are required for BTech admission?
para_question1: What documents do we need to apply for a BTech?
para_question2: What are the necessary documents required for BTech admission?
Answers: Documents required include 10th and 12th standard pass certificates, transfer certificate, conduct certificate, migration certificate, eligibility certificate issued by Nitte University, physical fitness certificate, blood group certificate, Aadhaar card copy, and photographs.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: Are there any additional documents required for NRI candidates?
para_question1: Do NRI students need any additional documents?
para_question2: Are there extra documents needed for NRI applicants?
Answers: Yes, additional documents for NRI candidates include valid Passport & Visa of parent/sponsor, residence proof, employment certificate of parent/sponsor, sponsorship certificate, and relationship certificate.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: What is the commencement period for BTech classes?
para_question1: What is the start date of BTech classes?
para_question2: When do the BTech classes start?
Answers: The BTech classes typically commence in July/August as prescribed by the University.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: How can I check the fee structure for BTech programs?
para_question1: How do I find out the fee structure for BTech programs?
para_question2: How can I look up the BTech program fee schedule?
Answers: The fee structure for both General & NRI categories can be found on the university's website under 'Program Fee'.For more information, visit https://nitte.edu.in/fee/BTECH.pdf

questions: Is there any age limit for BTech admission?
para_question1: Do we have any age limit for BTech admission?
para_question2: Is there a minimum age for Btech admission?
Answers: Yes, candidates should have completed 17 years of age as on 31st December of the admission year.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: Can I apply for BTech admission if I have studied Class 12 outside India?
para_question1: If I have studied Class 12 outside India, can I apply for BTech admission?
para_question2: Can I apply for admission to a BTech program if I studied my 12th grade outside of India?
Answers: Yes, candidates who have studied Class 12 outside India are eligible for BTech admission.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: What is the minimum aggregate percentage required in pre-university for BTech admission?
para_question1: May I know the minimum aggregate percentage in pre-university that is required for admission to the BTech program?
para_question2: What is the minimum score needed in pre-university for BTech admission?
Answers: Candidates must have a minimum aggregate of 45% marks in Class 12 or equivalent.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: Is there an entrance exam for NRI category candidates?
para_question1: Do the NRI category candidate have to take an entrance exam?
para_question2: Is there a separate entrance exam for NRI category applicants?
Answers: No, NRI category candidates are admitted based on marks secured in the optional subjects in the qualifying examination.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: How many passport size photographs are required for admission?
para_question1: How many pictures do you need for admission?
para_question2: How many passport-sized photographs are required for the admission process?
Answers: Five recent color photos with a white background (35mm x 45mm) and five stamp size photos (20mm x 25mm) are required for admission.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: Can I pay the fees in foreign currency for NRI category admission?
para_question1: Can I pay for NRI category admission in foreign currency?
para_question2: Are the fees payable in foreign currency for NRI category admission?
Answers: Yes, fees can be paid in foreign currency or INR from the NRE account of the sponsor for NRI category admission.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: What is the process for obtaining an eligibility certificate from Nitte University?
para_question1: How can I obtain an eligibility certificate from Nitte University?
para_question2: What is the procedure for obtaining an eligibility certificate from Nitte University?
Answers: The process for obtaining an eligibility certificate will be handled by Nitte University.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: How can I submit the admission enquiry form for NRI category admission?
para_question1: What is the procedure for submitting the admission inquiry form for admission in the NRI category?
para_question2: How can I submit the admission inquiry form for NRI category applicants?
Answers: Candidates seeking admission under the NRI category can submit the Admission Enquiry form available on apply.nitte.edu.in.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: What is the last date for submitting the NUCAT registration form?
para_question1: When is the last day to submit the NUCAT registration form?
para_question2: What is the deadline for submitting the NUCAT registration form?
Answers: The last date for submitting the NUCAT registration form will be mentioned on the university's website.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: Can candidates with a compartment in Class 12 apply for BTech admission?
para_question1: Are applicants to the BTech program eligible to have a compartment in Class 12?
para_question2: Can students who failed in Class 12 apply for BTech admission?
Answers: Candidates must have passed Class 12 without any compartments to be eligible for BTech admission.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: Is there any relaxation in eligibility criteria for reserved category candidates?
para_question1: Is there any easing of the eligibility criteria for candidates belonging to the reserved category?
para_question2: Are there any exceptions to the eligibility criteria for candidates from reserved categories?
Answers: The university follows the eligibility criteria strictly, but candidates may refer to the official notification for any relaxation provided for reserved categories.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: Can I apply for BTech admission if I have pursued a vocational stream in Class 12?
para_question1: Can I apply for BTech admission if I have pursued a vocational stream in Class 12?
para_question2: May I apply for admission to BTech if I have pursued a vocational stream in Class 12?
Answers: Yes, candidates from vocational streams are eligible for BTech admission provided they meet the other eligibility criteria.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: Can candidates with a gap year apply for BTech admission?
para_question1: May candidates who have completed a gap year be considered for admission to the BTech program?
para_question2: Can students with a gap year apply for BTech admission?
Answers: Yes, candidates with a gap year can apply for BTech admission, provided they meet the eligibility criteria.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: Can candidates from Arts or Commerce streams apply for BTech admission?
para_question1: Can students who studied Arts or Commerce apply for BTech?
para_question2: Are applicants to BTech programs eligible to come from the Arts or Commerce streams?
Answers: Candidates from Arts or Commerce streams are not eligible for BTech admission. They must have studied Physics, Mathematics, and Chemistry/Biotechnology/Biology/Computer Science/Electronics in Class 12.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: Can I apply for BTech admission in NMAMIT if I have studied in a foreign board?
para_question1: Can someone who studied at a foreign board apply for admission to the BTech program in NMAMIT?
para_question2: Can I apply for BTech admission in NMAMIT if I completed my education in a foreign board?
Answers: Yes, candidates who have studied in a foreign board are eligible for BTech admission, provided they meet the other eligibility criteria.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: What is the mode of the NUCAT entrance exam?
para_question1: What is the NUCAT entrance exam mode?
para_question2: What is the format of the NUCAT entrance exam?
Answers: The mode of the NUCAT entrance exam may be online or offline, as per the notification released by the university.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: How can I obtain the migration certificate from the Board of the last studied institution?
para_question1: How can I get the certificate for moving from the school where I last studied?
para_question2: How can I acquire the migration certificate from the Board of the last institution I attended?
Answers: The migration certificate can be obtained from the Board of the last studied institution by submitting the necessary documents and application form.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: Can candidates with a gap year apply for the scholarship?
para_question1: Can candidates who have a gap year apply for the scholarship?
para_question2: Can applicants with a gap year in their academic history apply for the scholarship?
Answers: Yes, candidates with a gap year can apply for the scholarship if they meet the eligibility criteria specified by the university.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: How can I obtain the physical fitness certificate from a registered medical practitioner?
para_question1: How do I get a physical fitness certificate from a registered medical practitioner?
para_question2: How can I get a registered medical practitioner to give me the physical fitness certificate?
Answers: The physical fitness certificate can be obtained by undergoing a medical examination by a registered medical practitioner and submitting the prescribed format.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: Can candidates with a diploma apply for lateral entry into the BTech program?
para_question1: Can people who have a diploma apply for the BTech program later on?
para_question2: Is it possible for candidates to apply for lateral entry into the BTech program with a diploma?
Answers: Yes, candidates with a diploma can apply for lateral entry into the BTech program, subject to fulfilling the eligibility criteria set by the university.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: How can I obtain the relationship certificate for NRI category admission?
para_question1: How do I get a relationship certificate for admission to the NRI category?
para_question2: When applying for admission under the NRI category, how can I get the relationship certificate?
Answers: The relationship certificate can be obtained from the appropriate authority by submitting the necessary documents and application form.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php

questions: Are there any specific requirements for the photographs submitted for admission?
para_question1: Are there any particular prerequisites for the photographs submitted for admission?
para_question2: Are there any specifications regarding the photos that must be submitted in order to be admitted?
Answers: The photographs submitted for admission should be recent, with a white background and the specified dimensions.For more information, visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/admissions.php
